channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY

item.title: Report E-2023110118
item.description:
Report E-2023110118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 teaspoons of (UN1917) Ethyl Acrylate (3/II) -was released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to improper packaging. Contractors arrived to find that a drum of DOW ethyl Acrylate with a pinhole puncture that released an extremely small amount of product onto the side of the damaged drum and potentially onto the trailer floor. The released material has fully evaporated but as a precaution, all nearby surfaces were treated with a simple green solution and was wiped down with pads. The damaged drum was overpacked and all impacted surfaces were cleaned and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110177
item.description:
Report X-2023110177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZMAT SPILL ON IR2, RESPONDER USED PPE AND DROVE THE SPILL TUG OVER TO THE LEAK. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE CORROSIVE HAZMAT LABEL, RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023110081
item.description:
Report X-2023110081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The 5 gallon bucket was found with a small pool of liquid at the tip of the drum. QA secured the drum in a lined red tote and wiped off liquid from the top. DescribePack: cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote

item.title: Report X-2023110030
item.description:
Report X-2023110030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was left in hazmat cage for hazmat trained admin to process. Note attached to hazmat states it was dropped. During inspection of contents it was found that 3 out of the 4 bottles inside had loose caps. Unsure of how caps came loose. DescribePack: Caps were loose causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote and kept in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023101384
item.description:
Report X-2023101384

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A hazmat was crushed, causing the metal bottle to pinch and cause a hole. We secured the package in a lined red tote and cleaned up the product with spill pads. DescribePack: Body of metal can was pinched causing a hole DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023101304
item.description:
Report X-2023101304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hub QA was called to local for a hazmat call. We arrived at local to a hazmat fuming and steaming. We cleaned up the hazmat with spill pads and cleaned up the floor with neutralizer. We secured the soiled clean up materials and package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose after it fell from the non-con conveyer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.
